meanings.definition: To pierce or tear with a sharp instrument.
meanings.sent1: She lancinated the paper with scissors.
meanings.sent2: The chef lancinated the meat with a knife.
meanings.sent3: The tailor lancinated the fabric with precision.
meanings.sent4: His words lancinated her heart like a dagger.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the blade lancinating the silence was deafening.

meanings.definition: To cause sharp pain or anguish.
meanings.sent1: The toothache lancinated through his jaw.
meanings.sent2: The memory of the accident lancinated her mind.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news lancinated his happiness.
meanings.sent4: The loss of a loved one lancinated her soul.
meanings.sent5: The piercing scream lancinated the peaceful night.
